contentHtml:
Write a program to print Fibonacci pattern

Input  : 5
Output :

1
1 1
1 1 2
1 1 2 3
1 1 2 3 5

import java.util.Scanner;

public class FibonacciPattern {

    public static int fibonacci(int n) {
        return n = (n <= 1) ? n : fibonacci(n - 1) + fibonacci(n - 2);
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
        System.out.print("Enter an integer : ");
        int n = sc.nextInt();
        System.out.println();
        for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
            for (int j = 1; j <= i; j++) {
                System.out.print(fibonacci(j) + " ");
            }
            System.out.println();
        }
        sc.close();
    }
}

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strconv"
)

func fibonacci(n int) int {
	if n <= 1 {
		return n
	}
	return fibonacci(n-1) + fibonacci(n-2)
}

func main() {
	var n int
	fmt.Print("Enter an integer : ")
	fmt.Scan(&n)

	for i := 1; i <= n; i++ {
		for j := 1; j <= i; j++ {
			fmt.Print(strconv.Itoa(fibonacci(j)) + " ")
		}
		fmt.Println()
	}
}

def fibonacci_pattern(n: int) -> int:
    assert n > 0
    a, b = 0, 1
    for i in range(n):
        print(f"{b} ", end="")
        a, b = b, a + b
    print(end="\n")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    pattern_lenght = int(input(
        "Enter the lenght of the Fibonacci pattern to generate : "))
    for number in range(1, pattern_lenght + 1):
        fibonacci_pattern(number)

#include <iostream>
using namespace std;

int fib(int n)
{
    if (n <= 1)
        return n;
    return fib(n - 1) + fib(n - 2);
}

int main()
{

    int n;
    cout << "Enter an Integer : ";
    cin >> n;

    for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++)
    {
        for (int j = 1; j <= i; j++)
        {
            cout << fib(j) << " ";
        }
        cout << "\n";
    }

    return 0;
}

frontMatter.title: Fibonacci Pattern
frontMatter.description: Write a program to print Fibonacci pattern
